The King Fahad Dam, previously known as Bisha Dam, is a gravity dam on Wadi Bisha about  south of Bisha in the 'Asir Region of southwestern Saudi Arabia. The dam has many purposes , such as serving flood control,  supplying water to nearby localities, irrigation and groundwater recharge. A water treatment  plant was built in conjunction with the dam and it can supply up to  of water to the city of Bisha a day. The dam was constructed between   1986 and 1997. It is named after King Fahad and is managed the Ministry of Water and Electricity. At  in height, it was the tallest dam in the country until the  Baysh Dam was completed in 2009. King Fahad's reservoir still has the largest storage capacity, at .
